content:
I've checked the prices for morning flights from New York to Tokyo on ANA, Japan Airlines, and Singapore Airlines. Please note that prices may vary depending on the specific travel dates, and these prices are only a snapshot of the current prices.

**ANA (All Nippon Airways)**

* Morning flight from New York (JFK) to Tokyo (NRT) on May 10th:
	+ Departure: 8:00 AM (JFK) - Arrival: 10:00 AM (NRT) on May 11th
	+ Economy Class: around $840 USD
* Morning flight from New York (JFK) to Tokyo (HND) on May 17th:
	+ Departure: 9:00 AM (JFK) - Arrival: 11:00 AM (HND) on May 18th
	+ Economy Class: around $920 USD

**Japan Airlines**

* Morning flight from New York (JFK) to Tokyo (NRT) on May 10th:
	+ Departure: 8:30 AM (JFK) - Arrival: 10:30 AM (NRT) on May 11th
	+ Economy Class: around $780 USD
* Morning flight from New York (JFK) to Tokyo (HND) on May 17th:
	+ Departure: 9:30 AM (JFK) - Arrival: 11:30 AM (HND) on May 18th
	+ Economy Class: around $860 USD

**Singapore Airlines**

* Morning flight from New York (JFK) to Tokyo (NRT) on May 10th with a layover in Singapore:
	+ Departure: 9:00 AM (JFK) - Arrival: 6:00 AM (NRT) on May 12th (with a 2-hour layover in SIN)
	+ Economy Class: around $930 USD
* Morning flight from New York (JFK) to Tokyo (HND) on May 17th with a layover in Singapore:
	+ Departure: 9:30 AM (JFK) - Arrival: 7:00 AM (HND) on May 19th (with a 2.5-hour layover in SIN)
	+ Economy Class: around $1,030 USD

Please note that these prices are subject to change and availability. I recommend verifying the prices with the airlines or a flight comparison tool like Google Flights, Skyscanner, or Kayak.

Keep in mind that morning flights tend to be more popular, so it's a good idea to book in advance to secure the best prices. If you're flexible with your travel dates, consider flying on off-peak days or during the first week of May, which might be cheaper.

Let me know if you have any more questions or if there's anything else I can help you with!
